question: Some of the accounts in banks are classified as "Special Mention Accounts". What are these accounts?
option1: The saving bank accounts which are paid higher interests on balance
option2: The loans which have become bad loans
option3: The loans which may become bad loans in future
option4: The loans on which principal has been paid back but interest is yet to be received
answer: The loans which may become bad loans in future
explanation: SMAs are on which interest payment is due and might become NPAs in future if such payments remain so. Read this about SMA-0, SMA-1 and SMA-2.
